medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral valgus deformity of the great toe.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first patient, a ten-month-old boy, exhibited bilateral valgus deformity of the great toe from an early age, and the second patient, a seven-year-old boy, showed characteristics of this deformity since birth. The first patient had an uneventful perinatal and postnatal course with normal developmental milestones. The second patient had recurrent examinations for hallux valgus and saw a provisional diagnosis made at six years of age. Neither patient has experienced significant progression of symptoms upon follow-up; however, both have neck stiffness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The father of the first patient has a significant medical history including corrective osteotomies for bilateral hallux valgus, a soft-tissue mass resection at age seven, and later diagnosis of fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva at age twelve, confirmed by genetic testing.
medical_history.family_history: The first patient's father was diagnosed with fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva and has a family history of hallux valgus.
medical_history.social_history: The second patient was noted to be a low-birth-weight baby born via cesarean section due to preterm rupture; social history for the first patient is not specified.
